title: Gatsby Clay
description: Image-centric Gatsby theme for publishers, portfolio, photographers blogs and more.
author: Travis Lord + Abdul Waqar

github.readmeContent:
![clay-gatsby-theme](https://github.com/lilxyzz/gatsby-clay/blob/master/src/img/Clay-Gatsby-theme.png)

Clay A Gatsby Theme | Demo | Lighthouse (90+)

**Image-centric Gatsby theme for publishers, portfolio, photographers blogs and more.** ### Features - Gatsby v5+ - PWA - Netlify/Decap CMS pre-configured - PurgeCSS for bundle size optimization - Netlify settings predefine - Netlify contact form Support - SEO optimized - 90+ Lighthouse ### Pages - Home - Bio - Work - News - Contact - 404 ### Coming soon - Light & Dark mode ## ðŸš€ Quick start [![Deploy to Netlify](https://www.netlify.com/img/deploy/button.svg)](https://app.netlify.com/start/deploy?repository=https://clay-gatsby.netlify.app/) ### Local development 1. **clone the repository** ``` git clone https://github.com/lilxyzz/gatsby-clay.git ``` 2. **cd into the project directory** ``` $ cd gatsby-clay ``` 3. **install all dependencies for the project** ``` $ yarn install ``` 4. **start local dev server** ``` $ gatsby develop ``` **Open the source code and start editing!** Your site is now running at `http://localhost:8000` _Note: You'll also see a second link: _`http://localhost:8000/___graphql`_. This is a tool you can use to experiment with querying your data. Learn more about using this tool in the [Gatsby tutorial](https://www.gatsbyjs.org/tutorial/part-five/#introducing-graphiql)._ **Inspired by Gatsby London**
